title: How expensive and available were books in 19th century America? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: It depends on the type of book. Charles Dickens had several different editions of his complete works available towards the end of his life in both England and America suitable for people of all walks of life, from the cheap edition right up through the connoisseur’s edition with leather binding. Then there were many cheap paperbacks such as the dime novels that were available at book stands at railway stations.

Howdy, New books were expensive (freight charges) used books could be had from wagon trains or folks dying for less. Civil War/1870s…a can of peaches cost $0.75. Soldier pay was thirteen dollars a month. Beer was half dime (made locally), whysky short bit or fifteen cents…good stuff two bits a shot. Local white lighting $1.00 a jug…
